item.title: Wok-Fried Prawns
item.description:
• Prep Time: 30 minutes
  • Cook Time: 15 minutes
  • Servings: 2

This recipe for for wok-fried prawns has become a go-to weeknight meal for me at home. Technically, you can make this recipe without a wok, but a proper carbon steel wok is nonetheless ideal. I usually serve it with some fresh jasmine, but feel free to serve with noodles as well.

Nom

Ingredients

  • 1/2 lb large prawns, peeled and deveined (tails on optional)
  • 1 tbsp vegetable oil (or peanut oil for extra flavor)
  • 4 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 tsp fresh ginger, minced
  • 1 small red chili, finely sliced (optional, for heat)
  • 2 spring onions, chopped (separate white and green parts)
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 tsp oyster sauce
  • 1/2 tsp sesame oil
  • 1/2 tsp sugar
  • 1 tbsp water
  • 1 tsp MSG (optional)
  • A pinch of white pepper (optional)
  • 1 tsp Shaoxing wine

Instructions

  1. Prep the Sauce: In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, sugar, water, and white pepper. Set aside.
